Message.Title: HMD Report Forecast 2012-2017 Growth Potential- Google Glass
Message.Msg: The key enabling technology, IMO here will be the Oled Micro displays, as LCD's displays dies the slow death. eMagin (ticker eman) will likely be one of the key players as this market takes off. eman is a maker of oled micro displays. Announced record earnings last wee, and up 30% since. I can see the Google glass HMD using eman's oled displays in the future as the consumer growth in this space takes off. Currently it is mostly prominent is Military & Industrial. Eman has the lock on both. Zero

Message.Title: Lucid observation
Message.Msg: This actually seems to make a lot of sense but then everyone is welcomed to their opinion... Take it for what it's worth... So how do trade a breakout? If you are looking to get long GOOG the way to take advantage of this move is to wait for the stock to breakout out and clear old highs and then wait for what happens next. Either the breakout will fail right at old highs or the stock will clear old highs only to be hit back down by those who fade breakouts. A stock hitting new high territory is a good sign but its what happens after the breakout that tells you if a run in GOOG will happen in the next couple of weeks. We would look to get long GOOG if 1 of the following 2 things happen: #1 If the breakout hits new highs but fails, pulls back above the old highs level and starts building a base. #2 If the breakout fails and is smacked down all the way back into its base but above the $638-$648 level. This is the level of the last consolidation and can act as support before the 2nd rally attempt occurs. The most favorable of the 2 setups is the #1 scenario where a pullback with at least 2 days will get us looking for a confirmation pattern and can allow us to get in at a very favorable price ahead of a potential big rally into new high territory. From PTS Research this afternoon

Topic.Title: Lucid observation

Message.Msg: I like the analysis, but I would also look at the other side but temper it with the low VIX, which is holding all stocks in a tight range. Away from the technical (FB was a flop so GOOG is strong), Android is working and gaining market share, Google Wallet, etc......... The low VIX is helping this the most. In the last few run ups over the BB upper this pulled back a good deal. The VIX is keeping it up and bad news (and I do not currently own) pulls this down a great deal.
